summary: The gloved snailfish is a species of snailfish found around the northern Kuril Islands in the northwestern Pacific Ocean. It is the only species in the genus Palmoliparis. This species can be found at depths of from 200 to 800 m. This species grows to a length of 42 centimetres (17 in) TL though more usually around 29.6 cm (11.7 in) TL.
